snippet: A simmering political scandal took a dramatic turn when a judge forced Vice President Amado Boudou to appear in a Buenos Aires court to answer questions.
abstract: Judge Ariel Lijo forces Argentinian Vice Pres Amado Boudou to appear in Buenos Aires court to answer questions about whether he had used his influence as economy minister to take ownership of a company that printed nation's currency.
lead_paragraph: A simmering political scandal took a dramatic turn when a judge forced Vice President Amado Boudou to appear in a Buenos Aires court to answer questions.

headline.main: Argentina: Vice President in Court for Questioning in Corruption Case
headline.print_headline: Argentina: Vice President in Court for Questioning in Corruption Case
